data.enText: to be used instead of sth/sb else; to do sth instead of sb/sth else

data.chText: 新的设计最终将会取代所有现有的型号。
data.enText: The new design will eventually replace all existing models.

data.chText: 课堂上电脑永远不会取代老师。
data.enText: Teachers will never be replaced by computers in the classroom.
to remove sb/sth and put another person or thing in their place

data.chText: 他离开后，他的位置很难有人接替。
data.enText: He will be difficult to replace when he leaves.

data.chText: 不吃正餐，改吃点心，这不是什么好主意。
data.enText: It is not a good idea to miss meals and replace them with snacks.
to change sth that is old, damaged, etc. for a similar thing that is newer or better

data.chText: 所有的旧地毯都需要更换。
data.enText: All the old carpets need replacing.

data.chText: 玻璃杯如有损坏，要负责赔偿。
data.enText: You'll be expected to replace any broken glasses.
to put sth back in the place where it was before

data.chText: 我小心翼翼地将杯子放回茶碟。
data.enText: I replaced the cup carefully in the saucer.
to replace the handset (= after using the telephone)

simple_means.memory_skill: re 重新 + place 放 → 重新放 → 复职，引申为代替

ex.enText: Who will replace Sam on the team?

ex.chText: 其中3个灯泡必须得换下来。
ex.enText: Three of the bulbs have to be replaced.

ex.chText: 他们用塑料椅子来代替木头椅子。
ex.enText: They replaced the wooden chairs with plastic ones.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，可以指取代、替换某人的工作，也可指用新的物品替代旧的、坏的物品。

ex.chText: 他已经准备好接替杰拉德在英格兰队的首发位置。
ex.enText: He is ready to displace Gerrard in England's starting line-up.

ex.chText: 天然气逐渐取代煤成为主要能源。
ex.enText: Gradually, natural gas has displaced coal as a major source of energy.

synonyms.bx: 指取代、替换某人或某物的位置。

ex.chText: 主厨说过可以用番茄酱代替醋。
ex.enText: The chef said you could substitute ketchup for the vinegar.

ex.chText: 苏珊生病没上班时，谁暂时接替了她的工作？
ex.enText: Who substituted for Susan when she was out sick?

ex.chText: 上场20分钟后他不得不被替换下来。
ex.enText: After 20 minutes on the field he had to be substituted.

synonyms.bx: 指用新的或不同的东西代替原来的，也指代理某人的职位或替代球员，常后接介词 for。

tr: substitute a person or thing for (another that is broken or inefficient or lost or no longer working or yielding what is expected)
example: He replaced the old razor blade
We need to replace the secretary that left a month ago
the insurance will replace the lost income
This antique vase can never be replaced

tr: put something back where it belongs
example: replace the book on the shelf after you have finished reading it
please put the clean dishes back in the cabinet when you have washed them

tr: put in the place of another
example: the con artist replaced the original with a fake Rembrandt
substitute regular milk with fat-free milk
synonyms can be interchanged without a changing the context's meaning

tr: take the place or move into the position of
example: Smith replaced Miller as CEO after Miller left
the computer has supplanted the slide rule
Mary replaced Susan as the team's captain and the highest-ranked player in the school

value.def: If one thing or person replaces another, the first is used or acts instead of the second.

example.ex: The council tax replaces the poll tax next April.
example.tran: 市政税在明年4月将取代人头税。

example.ex: ...the city lawyer who replaced Bob as chairman of the company...
example.tran: 取代鲍勃成为公司主席的市政律师

example.ex: The smile disappeared to be replaced by a doleful frown.
example.tran: 笑容消失了，取而代之的是哀伤的蹙眉。

value.def: If you replace one thing or person with another, you put something or someone else in their place to do their job.

example.ex: I clean out all the grease and replace it with oil so it works better in very low temperatures...
example.tran: 我把所有的油脂清除干净，然后用油来代替，从而使它在低温条件下运转得更好。

example.ex: The BBC decided it could not replace her.
example.tran: 英国广播公司认定那不能取代她。

value.def: If you replace something that is broken, damaged, or lost, you get a new one to use instead.

example.ex: The shower that we put in a few years back has broken and we cannot afford to replace it.
example.tran: 我们几年前安装的淋浴器坏了，但买不起新的来换。

value.def: If you replace something, you put it back where it was before.

example.ex: The line went dead. Whitlock replaced the receiver...
example.tran: 线路中断了，惠特洛克把听筒放回原处。

example.ex: Replace the caps on the bottles.

trans: 替换颜色；替换色彩；取代颜色；替换颜色调整命令
全部替换；替换全部；替代所有；全部取代

partsOfSpeech.dec: birth 出生 + place 放；地方 → 诞生地，出生地
dis 去掉 + place 放；地方 → 不放在那儿 → 移位
fire 火 + place 放；地方 → 壁炉
ir 不 + replaceable 可代替的 → 不能代替的
market 市场 + place 放；地方 → 市场
mis 错 + place 放；地方 → 把…放错位置
place 放；地方 + mat 垫子 → 餐具垫
place 放；地方 + ment 表名词 → 放置
re 重新 + place 放；地方 → 重新放 → 复职，引申为代替
replace 复职；代替 + able 可…的 → 可代替的
work 工作 + place 放；地方 → 车间
